item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "[Harry] had always suffered from a vague restlessness, a longing for adventure that she told herself severely was the result of reading too many novels when she was a small child." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "One doesn't generally look into mirrors when one is especially angry; one has better things to do, like pace the floor or throw things." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Rae Carson
item.description: "I love you the way a drowning man loves air. And it would destroy me to have you just a little." -- Rae Carson

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Rae Carson
item.description: "A quarterstaff is not very subtle. Or handy. If an kidnapper comes at me, what am I supposed to do? Say, 'Excuse me, my lord, while I pull my enormous quarterstaff out of my bodice?" -- Rae Carson

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Rae Carson
item.description: "Yes, I love him. Enough to follow him anywhere." -- Rae Carson

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Rae Carson
item.description: "If I were an enemy, and I started bearing down on you like this"- he [Hector] draws his sword, stretches the tip towards me, takes a single step in my direction- "what would you do?" Possibilities race through my head. Should I look for a weapon? Dodge and come up behind his guard? Trip him? Insult his mother?" -- Rae Carson

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Rae Carson
item.description: "You made me cut and dye my hair.” Surely he understands that we face greater problems? “I thought it would greatly improve your looks,” I snap. “Shorn hair is a sign of shame. You humiliate me greatly.” “I’ll light a candle tonight in honor of your dead tresses." -- Rae Carson

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Sarah J. Maas
item.description:
"In the garden, the Captain of the Guard stared up at the young woman's balcony, watching as she waltzed alone, lost in her dreams. But he knew her thoughts weren't of him.
She stopped and stared upward. Even from a distance, he could see the blush upon her cheeks. She seemed young—no, new. It made his chest ache.
Still, he watched, watched until she sighed and went inside. She never bothered to look below." -- Sarah J. Maas

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Sarah J. Maas
item.description: "Celaena," Chaol said gently. And then she heard the scraping noise as his hand came into view, sliding across the flagstones. His fingertips stopped just at the edge of the white line. "<i>Celaena,"</i> he breathed, his voice laced with pain--and hope. This was all she had left--his outstretched hand, and the promise of hope, of something better waiting on the other side of the line." -- Sarah J. Maas

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Sarah J. Maas
item.description: "His breath was warm on her neck as he bent his head, resting his cheek against her hair. Her heart beat so quickly, and yet she felt utterly calm—as if she could have stayed there forever and not minded, stayed there forever and let the world fall apart around them. She pictured his fingers, pushing against that line of chalk, reaching for her despite the barrier between them." -- Sarah J. Maas

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Sarah J. Maas
item.description: "With each day he felt the barriers melting. He <i>let</i> them melt. Because of her genuine laugh, because he caught her one afternoon sleeping with her face in the middle of a book, because he knew that she would win." -- Sarah J. Maas

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Sarah J. Maas
item.description:
"You're going to keep a low profile throughout the entire competition... You're going to stay solidly in the middle, where no one will look your way, because you're not a threat, because they'll think that you'll be eliminated sooner or later, and they should focus their attention on getting rid of bigger, stronger, faster champions like Cain.
'But you're going to outlast them,' Chaol continued. 'And when they wake up the morning of the final duel and find that <i>you</i> are their opponent, and that <i>you</i> have beaten them, the look on their faces will make all of the insults and lack of attention worthwhile." -- Sarah J. Maas

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Lisa Tawn Bergren
item.description: "Courage is not the absence of fear, but the decision that something is more important than fear." -- Lisa Tawn Bergren

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Lisa Tawn Bergren
item.description: "We froze. Neither of us moving, simply staring at each other, wondering if the other was going to move first. "You are," he whispered, "uncommonly stirring." He closed his eyes then, as if he had to in order to break the bond between us, then lifted me to the saddle and stared at the ground as he guided my feet into the stirrups." -- Lisa Tawn Bergren

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "Somehow, even in the worst of times, the tiniest fragments of good survive. It was the grip in which one held those fragments that counted." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "Never underestimate the value of knowing another's language. It can be far more powerful than swords and arrows." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "When one is silent, those around speak even more." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "Balthazar pledged to die defending his royal house of Lumuatere. Finnikin swore to be their protector and guide for as long as he lived. Lucian vowed he would be the light whom they traveled toward in times of need." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "Then I choose to drown. In hope. Rather than float into nothing." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "The king died last. They made him watch and what he did to those princesses and his queen I will never repeat as long as I live. But Isaboe knows, for she walked the sleep of a monster who was witness to it, and if I could have <i>one</i> wish in my life," he said through gritted teeth, "it would be that I could tear from her mind the memory such depravity. Sweet Goddess, that I would have such a gift. I would give my life for it." And then he was sobbing, despairing at his uselessness." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "A blind man can see what she feels for you and you for her. Your souls are not merely entwined; they are fused." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "I've been waiting for you all night and day,' she said. Froi shivered. He realised that the words came from Quintana the ice maiden. Realised, as he felt his face heating up, that the idea of this Quintana waiting for him with excitement spoke to parts of him he believed to be dormant. And then she winked. 'Did I do that right?' she asked. Her smile was lopsided and he saw a glimpse of the teeth. And Froi imagined that he would follow her to the ends of the earth." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "No stories or explanations,' Finnikin had once told him. 'When it comes to women, straight into an apology and you will find the rest of your life bearable." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: Desiree Bianca add a quote by Melina Marchetta
